results.title: Blueprint for the future: Melbourne 1985
results.brief_description: Describes the Master Plan intended to cope with Melbourne’s traffic situation in 1985. Intense survey work has been carried out, the information analysed in computers and the appropriate plans made, mainly in the form of overpasses and freeways. Stresses the need for a revitalised public transport system as well as roads. Underground railways and streamlined trains and buses are needed. Includes plans for St Kilda Junction, Westgate Bridge and the Melbourne Loop system. Narrated by Leonard Teale.

results.title: Blueprint for survival
results.creator_credit: Densey Clyne, Jim Frazier and Mantis Wildlife Films
results.brief_description: Shows the development of moth, beetle, lacewing and fly larvae, through periodic shedding of the rigid outer coating. Stages in nymphal development of the grasshopper, praying mantis, phasmid and sucking bug, final moult of a cicada and tree cricket and emergence of a butterfly are shown. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Blue water challenge
results.creator_credit: Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description: A stimulating and accurate portrayal of the Golden Fleece Great Circle Yacht Race, which makes a clockwise circumnavigation of Tasmania. Starting off Portsea, Victoria, in January 1980, a fleet of Australia’s leading ocean racing yachts sailon a course of over 800 miles of challenging stretches of water. It has now become the longest race which starts and finishes in Australia. No other credits available.

results.title: Blue watch
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Danger”.
One of the BBC series “Living with Danger” this film deals with the work of the Fire Service in the United Kingdom. The routine training courses and varied duties for full-time and part-time recruits are shown, and the highly disciplined teams of modern fire-fighters are also revealed as family and home-loving men, with spare time activities and individual hobbies. Culminates in a spectacular fire-fighting operation against a quickly spreading factory fire.

results.title: Blue pullman
results.creator_credit: James Ritchie, Edgar H. Anstey, British Information Services and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: Introduces the businessman’s first class express, the new 90 m.p.h. diesel Pullman. Undergoing its preliminary trials between London and Manchester, the features of the train demonstrate themselves with almost no commentary, and the final sequence shows the train in action seen from the air, and from the driver’s cabin.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Ritchie, Edgar H. Anstey, British Information Services and British Transport Films

results.title: Blowing hot and cold
results.creator_credit: Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Big ice: views of Antarctica”.
Provides statistics on some aspects of the Antarctic continent such as the size of the landmass as compared to Australia and the types of weather conditions experienced. Also presents the latest scientific evidence on the effect of the Antarctic ice mass on world climate. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Blowgun
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Indians of the Orinoco: the Makiritare”.
Explains that in a single day a Makiritare craftsman tailors a blowgun with precision fittings that will last for years. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Blow out
results.creator_credit: David Sims, Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: A light-hearted look at the New Zealanders’ obsession with four wheeled transport, including colourful footage of cars. Provokes ideas about the place of cars in society, as a status symbol and reflection of the owner’s personality.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Sims, Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: Blotto
results.creator_credit: James Parrott, Hal Roach and Hal Roach Studios
results.brief_description: An evening of quiet domestic bliss near the old fireside with Mrs Laurel (Anita Garvin) seated at a bridge table playing solitaire as her husband (Stan Laurel) tries to read a newspaper. However, Stan decides he needs a break from this domestic bliss and it falls to his dear friend Ollie (Oliver Hardy) to provide the excuse for his escape. They steal a bottle of booze from Laurel’s wife and head off for a wild old time at the Rainbow Club only to be later thwarted by one very angry wife in the form of Mrs Laurel. A Laurel and Hardy classic even if the plot is somewhat thin.
